snippet: The Academy Awards finally handed cinema’s most prestigious prize to a movie by a black filmmaker, the British-born Steve McQueen, but the win had all the earmarks of a true squeaker.
abstract: Best picture victory for movie 12 Years a Slave at 86th Academy Awards finally hands cinema’s most prestigious prize to a movie by a black filmmaker, British-born Steve McQueen, but many say it was a tossup right until the end; fact that McQueen did not win best director offers indicator of presumably narrow margin by which film won Hollywood's highest honor.

byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and MICHAEL CIEPLY

lead_paragraph: The Academy Awards finally handed cinema’s most prestigious prize to a movie by a black filmmaker, the British-born Steve McQueen, but the win had all the earmarks of a true squeaker.

headline.main: ‘12 Years’ Enjoys a Seemingly Narrow Victory
headline.print_headline: ‘12 Years’ Enjoys a Seemingly Narrow Victory
